abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, though institutional
            development impacts were only modest, with both performances
            by the Bank, and Borrower rated satisfactory. Lessons
            address three major subjects: (a) Rushing project
            preparation may come at a cost: many Bank projects suffer
            from excessively protracted and resource intensive
            preparation. On the other hand, rushing the preparation of a
            project, leaving details to be worked out to implementation,
            is likely to cost a disproportionately high amount of
            supervision resources, and carries the risk of significant
            delays in project start up. These risks were exacerbated in
            Georgia which, at the time of project preparation, was
            barely emerging from years of political, and economic
            turmoil, with little familiarity with the concepts, methods
            and requirements of the Bank's lending standards.
            Operations whose main focus is on institutional development,
            cannot expect to be successful without a minimum time
            devoted to prior policy dialogue, assessment of political
            context, and institutional framework. (b) Political
            commitment to reform should be cautiously assessed: The
            depth of overall commitment to political reform is difficult
            to judge, therefore caution should be exerted when
            interpreting specific political statements, for transition
            to democracy, like transition to market economy is a
            lengthy, and complex process, that involves a wide variety
            of actors, often with diverging interests. In such a
            context, if targets for the development outcome are too
            high, then. if the political process is delayed for one
            reason or another, the operation may find itself at risk,
            bereft of its objectives and reduced to disbursements as its
            primary purpose, and measure of success. (c) Relying on
            local capacity must be approached with carefulness:
            developing, and promoting the use of local technical
            capacity is a worthwhile objective. However, in a context
            where capacity constraints abound, the performance of an
            operation may be compromised. However, setting the
            responsibility to work on decentralization, and local
            government reform in the hands of local experts, even with
            no prior exposure to these concepts, though risky, did
            deliver modest results.
